paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.phenotype: ATTRv amyloidosis, initial symptoms related to carpal tunnel syndrome

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Thirty‐five individuals were ATTRv amyloidosis patients (25 males, 71.4%), diagnosed at a mean age of 62.5 ± 6.7 years.
Sixty individuals (27 males, 45%) were heterozygous carriers of one of the five TTR variants but did not fulfill the diagnostic criteria for ATTRv amyloidosis.

functional_data.summary: The Ser77Tyr variant is associated with a high prevalence of ATTRv amyloidosis in the Jewish Yemenite population.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in Jewish Yemenite families.
variants.population_frequency: Detected in 68 subjects of Jewish Yemenite descent.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and family segregation.
key_quotes: We estimated that in this population, complete penetrance of the disease occurs at approximately age 70 years.

patients.phenotype: ATTRv amyloidosis, initial symptoms related to carpal tunnel syndrome

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Nine individuals, all of Muslim Arab origin, were detected with the Val122Ile variant.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile variant is the only variant detected in individuals of Arab ethnicity.

variants.segregation_data: Not reported to segregate with disease.
variants.population_frequency: Identified in 9 subjects of Arab ethnicity.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on population frequency.
variants.additional_notes: No affected individuals reported among carriers.
key_quotes: Val122Ile was found in 9 (9.4%) subjects and was the only variant detected in individuals of Arab ethnicity.

patients.phenotype: ATTRv amyloidosis, initial symptoms related to carpal tunnel syndrome

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The Thr60Ala (p.Thr80Ala) was the third most common variant, detected in seven subjects.

functional_data.summary: The Thr60Ala variant is associated with ATTRv amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Not reported to segregate with disease.
variants.population_frequency: Detected in 7 subjects from a large Jewish family of Iraqi descent.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on family data.
variants.additional_notes: No affected individuals reported among carriers.
key_quotes: The Thr60Ala (p.Thr80Ala) was the third most common variant, detected in seven subjects.

patients.phenotype: ATTRv amyloidosis, initial symptoms related to carpal tunnel syndrome

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Five individuals from three unrelated Jewish families, two of Ashkenazi ancestry and one originally from Tunisia, carried the Val30Met (p.Val50Met) variant.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant is associated with ATTRv amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Not reported to segregate with disease.
variants.population_frequency: Detected in 5 subjects from three unrelated Jewish families.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on family data.
variants.additional_notes: No affected individuals reported among carriers.
key_quotes: Five individuals from three unrelated Jewish families, two of Ashkenazi ancestry and one originally from Tunisia, carried the Val30Met (p.Val50Met) variant.

patients.phenotype: ATTRv amyloidosis, initial symptoms related to carpal tunnel syndrome

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The Val32Ala (p.Val52Ala) variant was identified in four of her family members.

functional_data.summary: The Val32Ala variant is associated with ATTRv amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Not reported to segregate with disease.
variants.population_frequency: Detected in 4 subjects from a single Jewish Iranian family.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on family data.
variants.additional_notes: No affected individuals reported among carriers.
key_quotes: The Val32Ala (p.Val52Ala) variant was identified in four of her family members.

patients.phenotype: ATTRv amyloidosis, initial symptoms related to carpal tunnel syndrome

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Two variants, Ala81Val (p.Ala101Val) and Glu89Val (p.Glu109Val) were identified, each in a single subject.

functional_data.summary: The Ala81Val variant is associated with ATTRv amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Not reported to segregate with disease.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on individual case.
variants.additional_notes: No affected individuals reported among carriers.
key_quotes: Two variants, Ala81Val (p.Ala101Val) and Glu89Val (p.Glu109Val) were identified, each in a single subject.

patients.phenotype: ATTRv amyloidosis, initial symptoms related to carpal tunnel syndrome

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Two variants, Ala81Val (p.Ala101Val) and Glu89Val (p.Glu109Val) were identified, each in a single subject.

functional_data.summary: The Glu89Val variant is associated with ATTRv amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Not reported to segregate with disease.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on individual case.
variants.additional_notes: No affected individuals reported among carriers.
key_quotes: Two variants, Ala81Val (p.Ala101Val) and Glu89Val (p.Glu109Val) were identified, each in a single subject.

tables_processed.table_caption: Disease‐causing variants in TTR, identified among 95 clinically evaluated participants.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text and tables.
